meanings.definition: A device used to move fluids or gases by mechanical action.
meanings.sent1: The water pump helped the farmer bring water to his crops.
meanings.sent2: The mechanic fixed the pump in the car to make the engine work.
meanings.sent3: The pump at the fountain suddenly stopped working, causing a splashy mess.
meanings.sent4: Her heart was like a pump, constantly pushing love through her veins.
meanings.sent5: The old pump in the garden creaked as it drew up water from the well.

meanings.definition: To operate a pump to move fluids or gases.
meanings.sent1: Dad had to pump the handle to bring water up from the well.
meanings.sent2: The firefighters had to pump water from the river to put out the fire.
meanings.sent3: She had to pump the bike tire so she could go for a ride.
meanings.sent4: The DJ pumped up the crowd with energetic music.
meanings.sent5: The athlete had to pump his arms and legs to finish the race.

meanings.definition: To inflate or fill with air using a pump.
meanings.sent1: He had to pump air into the basketball before the game.
meanings.sent2: She used a pump to blow up the balloons for the party.
meanings.sent3: The kids had fun trying to pump air into the inflatable pool.
meanings.sent4: The tire pump hissed as she filled the bicycle tire with air.
meanings.sent5: The air mattress needed a good pump to make it comfortable for sleeping.
